meanings.definition: A large tropical fruit with a starchy texture, often used as a staple food.
meanings.sent1: The breadfruit was delicious and filling.
meanings.sent2: In the Caribbean, breadfruit is a common ingredient in many dishes.
meanings.sent3: When the breadfruit rolled off the table, it made a funny sound.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as warm and inviting as a ripe breadfruit.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the breadfruit cooking filled the kitchen with a comforting scent.

meanings.definition: The tree that produces the breadfruit.
meanings.sent1: Under the shade of the breadfruit, we enjoyed a picnic.
meanings.sent2: The breadfruit tree in our backyard provides us with ample fruit every year.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel climbed the breadfruit tree and stole some fruit.
meanings.sent4: The branches of the breadfruit tree reached towards the sky like outstretched arms.
meanings.sent5: The leaves of the breadfruit tree rustled in the gentle breeze, creating a soothing sound.

meanings.definition: The wood of the breadfruit tree, used for construction and carving.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter crafted a beautiful table from the sturdy breadfruit wood.
meanings.sent2: The intricate carvings on the door were made from seasoned breadfruit wood.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child tried to carve his initials into the breadfruit wood.
meanings.sent4: The breadfruit wood was so smooth that it felt like silk to the touch.
meanings.sent5: The rich color of the breadfruit wood added warmth to the room.
